content:
Yes, Thuringian can be quite difficult for a non-native speaker of German to learn and understand. Thuringian, like any dialect, has its own unique set of vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation rules that may be unfamiliar to non-native speakers. Additionally, Thuringian is primarily an oral language, so there is limited written material available to aid in learning the language.

However, if you are already proficient in Standard German, learning Thuringian may be a fun and rewarding challenge. It can deepen your understanding of the German language and culture, and give you a deeper appreciation for the linguistic diversity of Germany. As with any language, the best way to learn Thuringian is through immersion and practice with native speakers.
